name: Tough True or False Quiz | 10 Questions | General

questions.text: The first sequel to win Best Picture at the Academy Awards was 'The Godfather Part II'.
questions.explanation:
True.

	It was directed by Francis Ford Coppola. The Godfather Part II" (1974) and "The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King" (2003)is another film that has won an Oscar for Best Picture.

questions.text: The only man-made structures that can be seen from outer space are the Great Pyramids.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Many man-made structures can be seen from outer space.

questions.text: The United Nations was originally headquartered in San Francisco.
questions.explanation:
False.

	While the UN Conference on International Organization began in San Francisco on 25 April 1945, no headquarters were established at the time.

questions.text: Shanghai was once the largest city in the Communist world.
Canada is the second largest country in terms of size/area.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Below is a list of the world's biggest countries in terms of area. #1 Russia: 17,075,200 km2 (6,591,027 mi2)#2 Canada: 9,984,670 km2 (3,854,082 mi2)#3 United States: 9,631,418 km2 (3,717,727 mi2)#4 China: 9,596,960 km2 (3,704,426 mi2)#5 Brazil: 8,511,965 km2 (3,285,618 mi2)

questions.text: A cygnet is a baby dolphin.
questions.explanation:
False.

	A cygnet is a baby swan.

questions.text: The official ball for the WNBA (Women's National Basketball Association) is red, white, and blue.
NATO is an acronym for 'North American Treaty Organization'.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It actually stands for North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

questions.text: Phylicia Rashad (Mrs. Huxtable on 'The Cosby Show') was once married to a member of the Village People.
questions.explanation:
True.

	She was once married to the policeman.

questions.text: In 2000, The Mets and Cubs opened the Major League baseball season in Japan. This marked the first time that the baseball season has opened in a country other then the United States or Canada.
questions.explanation:
False.

	In 1999, the Padres and Rockies opened the season in Mexico.
